Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Welcome to Divination General! Come here for readings and a discussion of theory/practice.

Every method is welcome: Tarot, Runes, Cartomancy, Scrying, Pendulum, Cleromancy, I-Ching, Oracles, Tasseomancy, Necromancy, etc.

>If you're NEW, please READ the STICKY:
http://pastebin.com/2Wp1Q074

>Recommended /div/ links and books:
https://pastebin.com/sAkg9cMz

>MEGA with Divination Books:
https://mega.nz/folder/Jp8gQD7Q#om_2lEm1GL0qPIpSrQgrvA

>Guides made by some of our readers:
•Rustig on how to start with tarot:
http://i.imgur.com/2rodLWB.png

•Thoth's tarot and rune guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ciFuMOVDIkA18d9Rw-Zkklgigx-Y4XzJkGVeMTYWcic/edit?pref=2&pli=1

•Hijinks' revised divination guide:
https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

Going by Neville's teachings, he would tell you to not accept it. Yeah. This is what trips up a lot of people, you have to actually push through "seeming" failures and keep on believing that the situation will turn around. Persist until you win, even when you've literally failed. Another thing is that you skip the "means" and just go for the result.

I'm gonna give you an example with Helen Hadsell. She's another big name in the LoA space, having won like 5000+ contests. tl;dr, one of her stories is that she entered a contest to go to Paris, lost, and persisted anyways and ended up in Paris still. You can read the rundown here:
https://www.reddit.com/r/NevilleGoddard/comments/dnf91a/anybody_heard_of_helen_hadsell_the_lady_who_won/

>Psalms
First off, congratulations on your success. The thing about the Psalms, is that it's "easier" than LoA. You don't deny anything in the 3D. You accept that you have problems, and you bring those problems to the wisdom of the Psalms to fix. Much easier to wrap your head around, in my opinion. They're also flexible, in that you can mix whatever process you want with them, like visualization of the end goal, or even just writing down what you want (preferably in past tense of having accomplished/received it).

Do you know about the Purification Psalms? They're a set of 7 Psalms - 6, 32, 38, 51, 102, 130, and 143. You use them for when you have big problems in your life, and feel overwhelmed. As a personal testimony, whenever I use these Psalms, I become unfazed by anything. I feel practically bulletproof. Traditionally, you go through one of them a day, until you do the whole set, and you can rinse and repeat each week. Just keep doing that process until things get solved or until you're mentally clear. If you do feel choked on time, maybe do two a day, probably spaced out though by at least a couple of hours. The key is being consistent with them daily.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33804448
Psalms as in the Psalms in the Bible (look up any of them from Psalm 1 to Psalm 150). You don't need an actual book, you can read online, and whichever translation doesn't matter (I like KJV for the Psalm magic process since it's more poetic, but I also use NIV to study them as a hobby). Process is:
1) Pick any Psalm (if you pick Psalm 119, it counts as a bunch of Psalms,
2) Have a desire to fulfill, or a problem to fix
3) Read the Psalm out loud once without stopping
4) Read the Psalm again slowly, verse by verse. You can do this silently in your head. Try to decipher the hidden meanings within them, as to how they pertain to your mind, or your situation. For example, "enemies" would represent "negative thoughts".
5) Repeat this process daily until you problem's fixed, or until you get a definite feeling that the Psalm worked. If you've ever experienced "inspired action", that's what this feels like.

If you go to the OP's Library, there's a Psalms folder. You can read the two booklets there, and the booklet authors have Youtube channels about this too. The other, longer book about the Psalms has the "traditional" uses of each Psalm, which can get you faster results as opposed to just using any Psalm (but any Psalm can ultimately be used for any purpose).

Video examples of the process (you can skip the "talisman" segment, the guy just augments his practice with talismans):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eR5GsKtI5A4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qfW2WhOSrMo

From Encyclopedia of Spirits

>A Fifteenth-Century Spell to Receive a Visit at Night from a Succubus This spell derives from a fifteenth-century manuscript, which recommends that it be cast on Saturday or Tuesday evenings, before or after Agrat goes riding with her host. Have a separate, private room ready with clean, white sheets. The supplicant should wear clean, white clothing. Fumigate the room and the bed with aloes wood (agar; oud) saying: I adjure you, Agrat bat Mahalat, Queen Demon with the great, strong, and terrible Name, With the name of the Holy Angels and with the name of Bilar the heroic, King of Demons That you send me (Name) daughter of (Name), the beautiful maiden from among the maidens who follow you, Whose number is like the number of the days of the year And with the names of Metatron and Sandalphon. The end of the spell reads: “And the knowledgeable will understand.”

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Agrat bat Mahalat The Dancing Roof Demon; Mistress of Sorceresses Also known as: Igrat bat Mahalat; Ograt bat Mahalat; Agrath bat Mahalath Agrat bat Mahalat (Hebrew for “Agrat daughter of Mahalat”) is a queen of demons. She commands 180,000 malicious spirits (18 legions of 10,000 each). She also rides through the air in her big chariot leading smaller bands of angels of destruction. Lilith is her rival and competitor.

>According to a legend, Agrat came upon King David sleeping in the desert and coupled with him while he dreamed. She conceived and bore Ashmodai, King Solomon’s brother, rival, and alter ego. Agrat may be a fierce demon queen, but she is also a spirit of wisdom. She trains witches, procures succubi, and is believed to be the spirit who communicated magical secrets to Amemar, a fifth-century CE Jewish scholar. Agrat is allegedly more interested in human men than women, or at least they are the ones who are strongly cautioned against her. Men are traditionally advised not to be alone, sleep alone, or enter the water during the times of the week when Agrat is most powerful, lest they fall under her spell. Days: Agrat is at the peak of her power on Wednesday and Friday nights. At other times, Agrat inhabits places uninhabited by people (that’s where you’ll find her), but on those two nights she can go where she will and do as she likes. Once upon a time, Agrat was free to come and go as she pleased, wherever and whenever she wanted, but a compromise with Hanina ben Dosa, first-century Galilean rabbi, wonderworker, exorcist and general thorn-in-her-side restricted her powers. He agreed to halt his attempts to completely banish her, and she agreed to start keeping regular hours.

>>33797704
The Ascendant Ruler is the planet that rules the rising sign, in your case Saturn. It marks out an area of special interest for your life. In your case, your placement of special interest is depressing your ascendant ruler.
In astrology there is this thing called an aspect. There are various types of aspects. Co-presence is when two planets share a house, sextile is when they're within a range of three houses, square is when they're within a range of four houses, trine is a range of five and opposition is a range of seven. Any planets that are in houses right next to each other or six houses away, however, are in aversion. Aversion is when planets do not see and interact with each other. This is bad for your Saturn, because Saturn is in a house ruled by Mars but cannot connect with it to receive support. Although fsr in your chart the engine you're using is saying there's an opposition between Mars and Saturn instead of aversion, which seems like nonsense to me. Both in Placidus and Whole Sign, your planets should be six houses away.

That's the wrong way to think about the outer planets. Their influence isn't fainter, nor even "subtler" as a synonym of faint, but rather has been tricky to cartograph within an individual's psyche. The current descriptions out there regarding what exact influences Uranus and Neptune and also Pluto have upon one mind at the time of birth, even without delving into the energies of particular signs, are woefully insufficient to understanding them.

The murky sense we get is that Uranus represents somehow a "higher" part of the mind, in a layer above Mercury; while Neptune represents a "deeper" part of the mind, in a layer sub Mercury. That seems easy to grasp initially until you try to explicitly mentally map out the psyche and its whole physiology (so to speak). It takes on too much of a nebulous character that yields no specific information.

It is extremely easy to say, "Mercury represents the operation of the rational part of our minds." And go through the signs and write up accurate detailed descriptions of real life consequences. But nobody has seem to have done the same for Uranus and Neptune---nobody has seemed to say exactly how differently Uranus and Neptune in Capricorns *think*.

It's an area of research opportunity.

Looking for more recommendations for music to listen to while browsing. Nothing off limits in terms of style or genre as long as it feels like /x/ late at night

I'll start:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9AUFg3v_NI
>Horror youtuber who does scary story readings and also makes original music. Song is good and his videos have a really unique animation style and are worth checking out

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g92LvDHvHXY
>Legendary album with truly unsettling sounds. A bit intense but can instill paranoia like nothing else I've ever listened to. If I put this on while I'm home alone I can't always make it to the end

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4B74JQKfC0
>lo-fi spooky folk recordings by a band with great melodies and unique vocals. Singer uses a creepy falsetto and the whole recording sounds like it's physically falling apart on an old reel of tape or something. The chord progressions are very beautiful though so it makes for an interesting dichotomy

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q1KApkldBRI
>another folky sort of gem, not quite as lo-fi as above, though. larger arrangements and bigger sounds. sounds like the music that might be produced by a haunted church in the backwoods of louisiana or something

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XCrOnN-6Qqs&list=PLy5kryT0xrJOV5wZ5d6ihc0ywXIy5U1c_
>phenomenally underrated horror soundtrack blending classic elements with modern recording techniques from the time. really unique sounds

I'm writing this down before I forget it, it was a fleeting thing.

>in bed last night
>trying to sleep, I usually keep a rosary nearby
>having intrusive thoughts about my infant son being murdered and the aftermath where I become some kind of monstrous person
>this kind of thing happens a lot and I've learned to manage these thoughts but this one is just going on and on

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

My brother is the strongest man I know. If I can be strong in his eyes even without training after 7 years of having less testosterone than most women, then I shouldn't belittle myself.
So I've decided to start working out and learn martial arts. It doesn't matter if I won't be as strong as I'd have been as a man; transitioning gave me other things that are more important to me. Even so, I still want to become my best self.

I haven't even read LL, and I still feel like that sometimes. Earlier today, someone asked me to pray for him, and it took me a few minutes to gather my resolve to request Lilith's assistance. I managed to stay calm by recalling that I've never felt malice from her, and that she only helped me get what I wanted.

What I've realised lately is that what I fear isn't really her, but rather things within myself that I'm afraid of as I don't understand them, then project outwards onto her. And as those projections don't appear to be wrong, I come to fear her instead of myself. But then I see her expressing those things that I couldn't accept about myself in such positive ways instead, and I begin to realise it was my fears that caused those sides of me to come out in the wrong ways in the past. When it's coming from her in such a calm and dignified manner, she makes it look so natural, and I realise I can be like that too.

What I thought to be so monstrous and feared, turned out to be womanhood; in the most unapologetic sense, unfiltered by society's expectations. It's embarrassing to admit that I got those things mixed up, and it's honestly a lot to take in. But as I come to understand her, and myself, the fear fades away.
Of course, men nor women are inherently good or bad. But people can get so lost as they misunderstand each other, and themselves in turn. If they feel ashamed of things that are perfectly natural, it saddens my heart. It's useful to know what's socially acceptable, but people mustn't lose themselves.

I don't know if that relates at all to the fear in your own heart, but I feel like I understand it in a way. As people idealise others from their own limited perspective, they're in fact rejecting the parts they don't understand; then if those misunderstandings are revealed, that can be very shocking or even frightening.

>Since you have experience with this, can you tell me what awaits me at the end of this path?
It's a way of life that in many people instills a kind of discipline and gives them purpose. Islam doesn't allow drinking alcohol. Islam doesn't allow premarital sex. It also makes you focus on what food you eat. Things like that can be very good for some people. It's a way of life, so there really is no "end" to it. The religion teaches that you build up good deeds through your daily salat or prayer. You also do this by giving, which is called Zakat. That is to say giving money to support Islamic causes. Or support poor Muslims. There's also the discipline of fasting on the month of Ramadan, which is when the Quran was revealed to Muhammad. Muslims also tend to say things like "alaihi salaam" when mentioning a prophet and "Sallahu alaihi wa sallam" when mentioning Muhammad. Also "Subhan wa Ta'ala" when they mention Allah. Those Arabic phrases help emphesize the special nature of the prophets, Muhammad as the Seal of the Prophets, and Allah as the Praised and Exalted One.
>What was your experience with the Torah in general?
It was very interesting to study it, even though my teacher turned out to be a cult leader of sorts. I still read the Torah and what I learned has still helped me in my life. It has been expanded with other knowledge though.
>What was your aim and what did you get from it?
I got some insights into the nature of the divine and was able to transfer those into occult and magic contexts. It really is hard for people to understand, but the Bible is full of magic.
>I did the Salat 5 times a day for a full week now, and it gave me some insights into the nature of the islamic framework
Yeah, that's pretty much the heart of Islamic practice. The other part of it would be Zikr/Dhikr or Remembrance of Allah. That is like the Buddhists doing Nianfo/Nenbutsu. Sufi has a rich tradition of Zikr. You can find good examples of it on Youtube.

Not the guy you were responding to, but wouldn't the issue with finding archeological evidence from the Richat structure be that, going by the flood myths and the geological evidence of flood flow rippling in the dirt and sand of the area, the flood was sufficiently catastrophic in nature that nothing is left in the original location? IF the Richat structure was indeed the city of Atlantis, then the flood which came in the form of a massive rush of water from the east (along the Atlantean mountain range) would have washed over the location, grinding millions of tons of stone, dirt and whatever other detritus, carrying it all over to the western shores of Africa.

In short, if anything at all would have survived such a cataclysmic event, it would all probably be under tens of meters of mud and rock in the seabed. And that seabed itself could be spread out in whatever direction from the African coastline for who knows how many kilometers.

You've surely seen what happens to giant stones and whole houses in China or Pakistan whenever the local river decides to flood again. Half the city is gently flowing down the river in those videos. Just scale those river floods up by a few orders of magnitude and you'll have something approximating the mythical flash floods that swept the worlds in those days. There's nothing to be found at the Richat structure. It's all either ground up into dirt undiscernible from any other random handful of rock and clay or it's buried under the Atlantic.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Atlantis is known from Plato's dialogues with Timaeus and Critias where he credited it to a story the Egyptians had told Solon. It was founded by King Atlas, the son of Poseidon and the local maiden Cleito. It supposedly existed 9,000 years before Plato, outside the Pillars of Hercules which are assumed to be the Strait of Gibraltar. Plato heard the story thirdhand so any of his information may be off.

The name of Atlas appears elsewhere in early histories as different people. Herodotus's Histories describe a Mount Atlas and a people known as Atlantes in the region of Tunisia or northeast Algeria. This could be a remnant of a previous Atlantis civilization, or it could be a coincidence.

Sanchotheon's Phoenecian history includes many names from Greek legends. We don't know if they were in the Phoenecian original or if they were added by the Greek translator. Sanchotheon's Atlas was a son of Ouranos whose brother Ilus (Cronos) imprisoned him under the Earth. It's a different Atlas. Sanchotheon's Poseidon was appointed by Cronos to rule over Berytus (Beirut). For him to be the same Poseidon, he would have to cross to the far side of the Mediterranean and not bother to tell the story. They were contemporary with Thoth who Cronus placed in command of Egypt.

So... geopolitics at the time of Atlantis, begs the question. Which one?

The Dialogues tell a simple story of the sons of Atlas, from a base beyond the Pillars of Hercules, waging war against everyone in the Mediterranean until a natural disaster sank their home.

Sanchotheon has Egypt being conquered/founded by early Phoenecians. Given how old Atlantis is supposed to be, this may have been thousands of years after Atlantis fell.

Further evidence may come from the spread of genetics, language, cultural artifacts.

I'd assume by the Tuatha you mean the Empire of the Tuatha Dé Danann?
Contemporary mythological cannon says they we're the Gods/Heros who ruled Ireland before it's final invasion by the Celtiberian Milesians whom the current inhabitants of Ireland are said to be descended from.

I think the only really "lost" aspect of the Tuatha Dé Danan is where they came from.
They we're originally just part of the 3rd invasion of Ireland led by Nemed which was driven out by the Femorians (the original, monstrous inhabitants of Ireland); some of Nemeds group fled to Britain, others to Greece (who became the Fir Bholg, the 4th Invasion) but the Tuatha Dé Danann fled to the "far north".
In the north they found 4 highly advanced cities where they learned secrets of science and magic. They eventually returned to Ireland in the 5th invasion, finally defeated the Femorians once and for all, drove them into the sea and became the godlike rulers of Ireland.

The real mystery is the 4 cities; Falias, Gorias, Murias and Finias. There's not really much to go on from what I know, only that they were somewhere to the north of Ireland. They also brought back 4 treasures; a stone, a spear, a sword and a cauldron each of which had magical properties.
There's also Tír na nÓg (Land of Youth). When the Milesians defeated the Tuatha Dé Danann they drove many of them underground to become the Fae Folk but some of them supposedly fled west and set up a new society where they never aged.
Another Irish mythological island to the west that's possibly related is (Hy-)Brasil but I don't think that has anything to do with the Tuatha Dé Dannan.

Whenever and where-ever you find massive megalith constructions with interlocking and finely shaped stone with no mortar and sometimes moved hundreds and hundreds of miles and lifted into place.
That is to me, clear evidence that it was built pre-cataclysm.

Not all pyramids are built this way and some things that aren't pyramids were built this way but it's always the same preference to massive stone rather than smaller, easier to move/lift stones, never using any mortar or other binding agent, this interlocking technique prevalent across the globe and sometimes precise celestial alignments.
you will often find these places having been in use through the ages, with sacred sited built on top of them, you can tell which parts are pre or post cataclysm by the size of the stones alone.

>>33799374
Knowledge of Tartaria has been mainly passed through oral tradition. Some were recorded by European travelers in the Middle Ages or historians of the regions adjacent to the region of former Tartaria. But they usually conflated and/or mixed the original stories with those of more recent empires in history.

Tartaria was an advanced civilization inhabited by the Tartarians; a race of people with great stature and mind. They harnessed the power of certain magical stones, called Yada stones, which are said to protect from natural disasters, control the weather, heal sickness, and which were the reason for their great physical height. When the Great Flood swept over the world, Tartaria was hit by the debris and mud upheavaled by the flood. This great mudflood destroyed their civilization, burying it miles under heavy soil, thereby creating the Inner Asian steppes. The Tartarian race was forced to the brink of extinction, but a few managed to survive the mudflood by seeking refuge in the caves and valleys of the eastern mountains. When they reappeared a long time after, their home was gone, the Yada stones lost, and with it their great stature.
Faced with a new reality they had to adapt to their new home and took up a nomadic lifestyle, grazing their animals miles above their buried Antediluvian civilization.

One has to read between the lines of ancient Chinese, Middle Eastern Arab, and ancient Greek histories to uncover the true Tartaria.

My argument involves you finding out yourself.

If you are interested in understanding, have this exercise:
1- see where the photo is from.
2- see which is the next island or mainland that you should have in front (reviewing a map)
3- See how much can be observed of that mainland, or if it can be seen partially, or if it can be seen in its entirety (it does not matter how far away the next piece of land is)

From the following exercise you can have the following results

A-Partially view the following mainland.
B-See nothing of the next mainland
C-See completely the following mainland (you must see the coast and without cut buildings).

If the result is A or B, the earth has curvature, If the result is C, the earth is flat.

>>33769773
I've already done so several times, but here you go.

Me and my friend drove to an isolated spot near a creek to do some drinking. We feel like we are being watched when we pull up and park. A few minutes later, all we are doing is watching behind us (parked backwards to the woodline) and I see a pale white form standing out from the darkness. It's skin was like dry old dusty leather with varicose veins that are blue. I freak the fuck out and tell my friend to drive away. As we drive away me and him see the damn thing run across the road. It was incredibly fast and I saw it just barely long enough to make out its form. It was tall, had skinny arms and legs and a unusually small but round head (compared to its body). We drive away a few miles and it fucking follows us down the road, it kept up with the car.

We park at a lit parking lot that had cameras over it. It pops up a few hundred feet in front of us near some bushes and an unlit road. We take some pictures but they are of a quite shit quality for a multitude of reasons. Picrel is the one picture we got that shows something, a pair of eyes.

After an hour we decide to drive to the center of town to a 24/7 gas station for water and human contact (it was 2AM at this point). We exit the parking lot but are stopped at a light before the main road. To my right is a Grove of trees. Friend says he saw something moving over there.

My eyes adjust and I see the upper portion of its head peaking from behind a tree. It was staring directly at me. It eyes seemed huge but it was in fact it's eye sockets which absorb almost all incoming light. I couldn't look away and after a minute of probably the most horrifying, traumatic experiance of my life, I tell my friend to drive away. The moment I could no linger sustain eye contact I broke down into tears for about 30 seconds.

Words cannot fully describe how terrifying and evil these things are, and I had the luxury of encountering it from the safety of a car!

posts.com:
I block out the real terrors. I can't bring myself to remember them and I never write them down despite writing down all my dreams.

The scary ones I remember are the invisible ones that attack me. They triggered major traumatic events in my life. They came and held me down, many invisible hands, pushing. They wanted to put me under the bed. I googled it afterwards and in some cultures they are called Kaboose, or 'the pressure'. These nightmares were terrifying, it was as vivid and ordinary as real life until the pressure took hold of me. I have also had a booming voice say my name, audibly, in what felt like waking life, though it must have been hypnogogic trance.

I was attacked in a dream again a couple weeks ago. Here are my notes for that dream

>He was tall and lean. Dark. I told him I was sorry and that I didn't mean any harm. I told him I wanted the best for him. I was looking out for him. His hand reached out to me. I had a feeling his gesture was violent, but I caught his hand and pressed it to my chest lovingly as I told him I just wanted the best for him. I wanted him to not . . . his hand was pressing closer and I felt as though his hand was rising up my chest to my neck, and I almost leaned into it. My eyes became blurry. I stared directly at him as I told him repeatedly I just wanted to know you; I just wanted to know you . . . as I looked at him I saw his entire being was nothing but a black blur, a smudge, a smoke, pure black . . . I just wanted to know you . . .
>I woke up with my hand at my chest and a strange feeling at my throat. Did I feel something behind me? Touching me? I was terrified that I was not alone. I remembered the Hawaiian cords that travel from the crown and imagined something there, at my cord, at the crown of my skull. My right ear was flat to my pillow. I heard a sound like buzzing, like a breath, loud, like my ear was cupped by a seashell or like my something was breathing heavily close to me.

>>33769286
grew up in canada, and we had a channel called YTV, I think it's still around. But anyway, there was this show back in the mid 90s, with these 3 puppets, I think they were white and they each had different colored hair that was made from sparkly tassels or something. Anyway, there was a red one which I think was the leader, a blue one and a green one. For some reason I think they were a "band" or something. Only thing I can remember is them kinda bouncing around on a puppet stage thingy, with their hair flying all around. Very hazy memories of them, I've tried finding the show over the last 2 decades but I cannot find anything relating to it.
So, onto the good stuff. Around 1994 to about 1997 at the old house I lived in as a young kid, I would have these nightmares every night of these three. I am 30 now and can still remember some of them vividly. These dreams always felt very real and I always dreaded going to bed every night because I knew they would come.
They always started off with me in bed waking up at some point in the middle of the night after my mom had gone to sleep. I had a night light on and always had my radio on with the oldies channel on, so old boomer music from the 50's and 60's would be playing. So, I would awake in my racecar bed, which was facing the bedroom door and the only light would be from my night light, so pretty dim. I could see the hallway, the white walls were always a sorta nighttime blue hue and then blackness at the end of the hallway where the bathroom was with the stairs to the main floor off to the left. I would always be awake for a few moments and then I would hear voices coming from down stairs, like whispering voices, like mischievous they were up to no good. They would be talking coming to get me. Then I would hear running up the stairs and the three "puppets" from the show would come running from around the corner of the stairs into the hallway into my room to get me. I would wake up every time. Cont.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33773161
I would wake up every time they were about to kill me. Here's the kicker, they looked absolutely nothing like the puppets from the show. They were always adult sized in height and medium builds, not too lanky or bulky. Their hair was always really long and poofy, almost like the hair styles you'd see on glam metal band members. They always had paper white skin and these paper white jump suits with stripes going across from their mid arms and chest. Their hair and stripes on their jump suits were were the same colors from the actual puppets on the show, so Red, Blue and Green. I remember the eyes on each of them were black with tiny white pupils that glowed and they had sinister grins with razor sharp teeth. They fucking horrifying! Legit getting shivers typing this out, remembering these thing's and the setting. I can still remember it like it were yesterday, the smell of my room, the droning sound of oldies music playing and these freaks making a mad dash up the stairs and into my room surrounding me in my racecar bed, getting ready to eat me with those sharp teeth.

Anyway, this one dream I remember the best. I awoke in my playroom in the middle of the night, which was down the hall next to the bathroom which was down the hall from my bedroom. I remember waking up in the middle of the carpet with moonlight shinning into the room, being the only light source in there, I was facing the door into the hallway which was pitch black. I remember thinking to myself in the dream "how did I get here? They'll be here soon and I'm not in my bed." I had a feeling of dread over come me and was thinking of booking it to my room, but was paralyzed with fear and didn't move. Sure enough, moments later I heard them down in the living room, walking and whispering. Then the footsteps coming up the stairs. I saw the silhouettes come around the corner of the stairs and they bolted into the playroom, quickly surrounding me laughing like psychos and making these noises like I dunno even know how to explain. They sounded psychotic, and were about to eat me. Then I woke up in bed, scared as fuck, lel.

Ill keep them short and sweet then. These are the ones that really stick out.

One dream turned nightmare has me running first person through a nice neighborhood on a windy spring day. However all of these houses were right next to each other, only divided by their fences with a bit of yard grass in between.
I turn around and look to see a tornado forming above me, I make a quick decision to break into someones home to seek shelter.
Inside it was scary quiet, as if it was me in a void. I hear the sound of someone snoring off in the distance. I close in and notice an elderly Chinese man dressed in an ornate, red Chinese robe. The kind a Kung-fu grandmaster would wear. He looked to be napping sitting down on his couch, the living room was surrounded by authentic martial arts weaponry and ancient artifacts. I hear something crunch under my foot and before I could realize what it was I hear a deafening scream coming from the old man. Think those baby plants from Harry Potter. It all happened so fast, but in a matter of one second he gets up from his couch draws a bladed chained looking weapon and everything turns to black. I assume I died before I even hit the ground.

Another was where I was a king of some ancient Sumerian style city-state, surrounded by absurdly tall guard walls. About the size of a 15 story building.
After I take a tour of my city and met with all of my subjects ( I could tell I was a beloved leader that was trusted and respected, though I could also tell that some of the elderly and mature people seemed uneasy about something else going on)
I finally demanded my royal guard, after their many efforts to divert my attention, that I wanted to see what was beyond those walls.
They finally conceded, and led me to one of the doors opening to a winding staircase.
I reach the top and am heart struck by what I see.
Surrounded on all sides, approximately 3 miles(5 kilometers) of desolate no mans land separated us and an extremely hellish mountain range that encompasses our city full circle. The mountains were covered in dark black ash cloud with intermittent thunder illuminating the silhouette of jagged peaks and red hot hell.
They seemed to close in. I couldn't quite tell, but it seemed as it was creeping closer and closer.
I finally realized then what the walls were for.
I looked at my one guard accompanying me.
He looked defeated, almost as if he wanted to cry. We said nothing, but understood. There was nothing that could be done. We were all going to perish.

There's some blown out ruins ahead of me at about 400 meters distance, and I can see what are apparently the enemy being silhouetted against the sky through the windows and cracks of the buildings.
It's cold and drizzling, the sky is grey, and the ground I'm laying on is muddy.
There's apparently an advance by them because then they're right up on top of me, < 20 meters. That's when I realize that I'm not the only one laying in that pile still returning firing.
There's movement as some of my guys jump up and are scurrying forward the best they can.
I'm real low on cartridges, so I call out, "Hey, anyone there, you got any ammo?!"
I recognize the face of the man that runs up to me, a personal friend, though at the time I can't quite place him.
He hands me eight cartridges, five on a stripper and three loose. I notice he's not carrying a rifle.
"Here comrade, make them count!"

posts.com:
Back in the year 2012 I had an incredibly vivid nightmare about fighting machines.
I was somewhere I understood to be Northern California, near the coast. I was separated from my friends and family and fighting alongside a group of strangers. We had no uniforms, and there were women and unarmed people in our group. We looked like homeless people with guns.
Suddenly this huge, dark cloud of whirling flying machines comes over the horizon. It came up and over one of those big, steep hills like they have in San Francisco. Countless machines actually darkening the area with their shadows. They looked like the man hacks from Half Life 2.
There was so much fear and panic.
We started retreating inside this shitty looking building to hide. The windows were all boarded up and there were objects like mattresses and tables places against the walls and windows to make them thicker.
We understood somehow that the machines could see through walls and this was our crude effort to hide as deep inside the house as possible and avoid being seen. Walls bolstered by fucking mattresses and cardboard and whatever was there to sort of "muffle" their vision.
We put the women closest to center of the house and posted up with rifles behind over. I remember being aware of them coming by the windows and looking for us.
As the cloud of machines attacked, different parts of it split off and spread out down the alleyways and streets. It was like they all had one mind and each rotor thing was just a single digit of this gigantic organism. You could hear screaming off in the distance when they bore down on a particular house and discovered someone.
It wasn't until around 2020ish that I saw that Chinese footage of a drone swarms and recognized it from the dream.

when i lived in a somewhat rural area that was expanding with new developments over time I saw/heard/experienced a lot of weird shit. And other people have too. Since I don't live there anymore i'll dox myself for the sake of storytelling. place is called Cumberland Beach in Ontario, immediately across the lake from an Ojibwe reservation and was Ojibwe land a long time ago. I'll start with my stories then move on to one I heard from someone I know (story pertains to her childhood friend)

>be me about 4 years ago now
>like going /out/ because nothing else to do in tiny community, no car
>huge development in backyard, gated, in construction at the time. Built on farmland.
>cars lining surrounding streets because 3/4 of parking lot had to be not built due to uncovering of graves during excavation
>le indian burial ground
>parking lot was on the back wall of the development, over the fence from neighbors backyard
>on the other side of development was long wooded road, was about 2 miles long
>one side of road had woods belonging to gun club
>other side has patch of woods belonging to no one (was eventually bought by development)
>road leads to other patch of woods, wetlands, unsuitable for building so popular spot for hikers and such
>walking back from going hiking, is twilight
>walking down the long road with the woods
>footsteps double
>stop
>hear nothing
>start walking
>footsteps double again
>stop again
>hear loud panting right in my ear
>whip around
>nothing
>start speedwalking
>speedwalking doubles
>sprint
>hear panting, now more distant, until i'm ~100m from a house
>get back without incident

posts.com:
Had out-of-body experiences where I visited a large house with an old woman who lived alone. Each time I visited she knew I was there and spoke to me, and warned me about an evil demon in her basement. She would say she really did not like going down into her basement, because the evil thing was there trying to frighten her.

I visited the house without really meaning to, but I kept being "brought" there, I guess? The old woman was nice enough, but she really did seem afraid of her own basement. I decided I was going travel to the basement and face whatever was down there.

When I approached I could sense guttural noises like meat being chewed and growling, etc. At first, I wasn't sure what the thing was but I could tell that it was malevolent and wanted me to leave. I began getting closer and focusing more intently on it, which angered it. It took the form of a large gnarled beast with pale skin and sharp teeth gnashing at me; think a kind of pig-like humanoid with fangs and wrinkled skin. I was completely unafraid and I felt absolute certainty that I was much stronger than this thing that was so desperately trying to frighten me.

Finally the thing charged me with its mouth agape and I extended a "hand" toward it and drew it into my palm. Even though it wanted to bite me, the force of my palm was such that it could not move at all. I willed it into the ground beneath the earth and stomped above its head as the last of it sank down. There was a crack through which it's eyes could still see me and it looked up from it's new home and I could see it lost its monstrous form and was now just a man. I got the impression that this was the spirit of a wicked man who died, and was trying to stay behind by feeding off the fear of whoever it latched onto. I didn't allow it to pass on, since I couldn't be sure it would do so if I set it free, so now whenever I dream I see it's eyes filled with rage staring at me from below the earth. Never was able to find the house again.

posts.com:
this thread is right up my alley right now, literally just last night i had a dream about "entities"

entities really are the best way to describe them. most of them seemed malicious, but not quite "evil" enough to be called demons in the abrahamic sense.

i was in some dark complex, being chased and attacked (hunted?) by these invisible beings, desperately trying to find an exit, or at least a hiding spot. i managed to find a corner to lay low and catch my breath, but was found by one such entity. although it was invisible, i could still feel its presence there, and it felt different from the others.

this one told me that it was not like the others, and that it would not hurt me. it offered me help getting to safety, and protection not just in that moment, but for the rest of my life. all i had to do was let it into my body, with the downside that at some point in my life, by random circumstance, my earlobes would end up getting sliced open or mutilated. i thought "man FUCK my earlobes, i want outta here!"

as it entered my body, i got a sense that this being in particular was incredibly ancient, older than any recorded religion. it guided me to a wall, which opened for me, revealing a wide, empty sky. the being told me to jump, and after hesitating for a moment, i trusted it to keep me safe, and did as it said. instead of falling, i glided through the air, eventually passing by mountains, and finally landing near civilisation.

i'm normally very skeptical and not very spiritual, but something about this dream just hit me differently. it could be just that this dream was my brain's way of telling me that i feel overwhelmed in life and without guidance or direction. or i could have just let some ancient amoral spirit posses my body, which does sound a bit less depressing.

This has actually happened to me multiple times in my life. Each time, it's a recurring dream, or at least one where I encounter the same evil being repeatedly.

First time was when I was ~5 or so. I would see a witch, like a traditional movie which with gnarled green/grey skin. She brought me to a temple and was going to eat me, and would cackle as I cried and begged to be released. I would be locked in a wooden cage and made to watch as she prepared the rest of the ingredients. I would always wake up before she killed me, but each time I returned she would stick me in cage.

Finally, after many dreams where this witch made me feel so helpless and afraid I decided that I had to try and do something. I deliberately returned to her, knowing that she would put me in cage. Only this time I didn't cry and beg. She turned her back to me, as usual and I *exploded* out of that wooden cage. She turned, wide-eyed, the evil laughter gone. I grabbed her legs and dumped her over into her own fire. I vaguely remember waking up immediately, and silently whispering "I did it..." before falling back to sleep.

Never dreamed of her again.

I spent quite some times in similar places. I work as a museologist in germany and during WWII, many museums and galleries hid their artifacts and artworks in those or similar places so they wouldn´t get destroyed in the bombings.

First place I worked at, found a "new" network of tunnels in the 2010s and we spend a lot of time in there finding loads of the museums old inventory.

Nothing spooky, tho.

Don´t get me wrong, I don´t doubt that there might be some weird things happening in those in other places, but my own experiences have been insanely cool, but tame in the creepy/paranormal sense.

There's some definite hobos that live in one that's near me. Some junkies hang around there too.
One of the weirdest things is that right by them are some different tunnels that were used in WWII for safety during bombing raids. You can get like guided tours and things of them by local historians. Why I always think it's weird is because, a few years ago now I seen an ad on Craigslist for something innocuous like books or something and responded to it. Then the dude started bombarding me with lewd pics of his ex-gf who's a historian that does tours of the tunnels and told me to go on a tour, fuck her (because "you definitely could if you just try") and then give him all of the details.
I thought he was just some nutcase sending random pics, but about 6 months later I was on facebook and the same woman was tagged in pics with my cousin who had been on a tour of the tunnels with her. She's pretty hot in that nerdy kind of way too.
Bit weird that's all.

In the heart of Stockholm, Sweden, there lies a mysterious place known as "Drömmarnas Brunn" or "The Well of Dreams." It is said that this place can be accessed through a sewer lid in the city, leading down into a vast network of tunnels and chambers that stretch for miles beneath the surface. As one enters the Well of Dreams, they are greeted by a warning: "You have found the well of dreams but you will never find the Tunnel City." This cryptic message is said to hint at the existence of a hidden community of outcasts who live within the tunnels, choosing to remain hidden from the outside world. Many stories and legends surround the Well of Dreams and the Tunnel City, with some claiming that it is a place of magic and mystery, while others view it as a dangerous and lawless place to be avoided at all costs. Whatever the truth may be, one thing is certain: the secrets of the Well of Dreams and the Tunnel City remain shrouded in mystery, waiting to be uncovered by those brave enough to venture into the unknown.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33785191
I used to work for Con Edison back in the 90s before I changed to sanitation. I had to change jobs because it was too fucking freaky down there.

New York City has hundreds, maybe even thousands of miles of tunnels. Some of which go back all the to the fucking 1800s.

We found all kinds of shit down there, bodies, animals, a fucking bear once. Entire fucking homeless cities with dozens of people living there.

I've seen and heard the weirdest shit you couldn't imagine. I'll never go back down into the maintenance tunnels again after this one time.

I was working on a route under the lower east side, right outside of downtown. It has one of the highest rates of shit breaking going on down there because all the businesses and huge homes and condos. They put such a tremendous strain on the system, there are constant fires and outages.

We were really deep in the old tunnels where the walls are sandstone bricks from the early 1900s, everything is brass and the wires are covered in thick heavy coating, almost like cardboard. At the time, all the main wires had not been replaced, yet.

I was pulling down a junction box with my buddy, and we both heard this fucking low pitch guttural sound, like a cat throwing up, but long like a growl. So we stop and look, cause there are feral animals down there, and the rats are fucking huge. They're a serious threat.

We turn and look down the corridor into the darkness, and there's this fucking creature standing there at the turn. Maybe 4 feet tall, extremely thin and gangly looking. Its eyes were bright orange in my headlamp. It was standing there in the corner just watching us, pacing back and forth and growling.

My friend and I fucking ran out of there so god damn fast I tore my ankle slipping up the catwalk into the main tunnel. Two months later I transferred to sanitation with DSNY. Never fucking looked back.

I'm 61 now, about to retire. I'm planning to move out of New York into the rural area of Pennsylvania.

If one claims the earth is flat then they are saying that their view of world is substantially different than what is commonly accepted.
And as a logical argument it's not as crazy as it sounds.
If one believes the Earth is round then they are saying that their world view is created from the acceptance of many theories about the planet and our place in it.
This is not as logical as it may seem since on one side it is more logical to believe only those things one can see and experience, like the conception that the earth is flat because it appears that way in everyday life. One can even make the case that the flat earth is the only one we can ever know.

On the other side of it we have to believe the contrary by trusting many things we cannot see or experience in everyday life. The fact that the earth is round is not important to most people and it only matters a small bit really cause of weather patterns. Basically, one cannot really verify the earth is round without making an effort to discover it so it's illogical to accept it as fact when the earth is quite flat in appearance everyday.

Oh, absolutely. A lot of people today awaken kundalini unintentionally, either spontaneously or as a result of a extreme emotional or trauma response. It can happen even without intentional intervention or preparation. You could also practice some kundalini awakening meditations without sufficient energetic awareness, which is why generally you'll see a warning on these techniques to make sure to wait a week or two before trying an awakening technique a second time. Now, releasing kundalini energy is kind of like peeling one petal of an infinite and immortal flower - when people without energetic awareness do this, they may not necessarily feel it, so they think "oh huh, that didn't work, let's try again". So they do it ten more times, and then spend ten years in a psychiatric hospital because they're flooded their system with way more energy than it could reasonably handle, manage and use up, like flooding an electrical appliance with ten times the electricity it needs - it won't work "faster" or "better", it'll just break down. Some further advice I can give. First, I would recommend that you look through the Traditionalist school authors. They are very reliable people and if you understand their works you will have a frame of reference to distinguish sound knowledge on these subjects from bad info. Evola is also included, particularly his spiritual books, even though the wikipedia editors have excluded him for some reason. Not all of the stuff you see on kundalini will be the best, because there was nothing like the flow of information back then that we have now. The principles are perennial, however, and will help guide you.
Second, about energy. The terminology is kind of ambiguous and can have slightly different connotations, but generally, energy, chi and prana are loosely equivalent. For a breakdown on energy (specifically chi), you can check out Damo Mitchell's Intro to Daoist Nei Gong. He has a section on this that you may find useful. I think that's a book I can probably mention on /x/ with clear conscience.
As to the difference between energy-as-such and kundalini energy in particular, it comes down to this: the energetic level is a kind of subtler level of the physical (or the physical is a denser level of the energetic if you prefer). This energetic level is kind of superimposed on top of your body and you rely on it for a lot of your normal functioning. This applies to all people. Kundalini energy is a special energy - it is the transcendent force, and it has a purpose and a goal which, once awakened, it pursues without pause, even if you suddenly have second thoughts. This transcendent force aims to help you overcome your conditioned existence, purge your energy system (which involves a lot of emotional/trauma releasing since those are stored as energy, and it also involves kriyas), and finally, when the process is complete and it fully develops your 7th chakra, you receive a strong connection to the divine, and enlightenment.

The human needs to do certain movements and gestures that signal to the body to integrate with the self. The techniques for doing this were not discovered, but rather they were taught to ancient peoples as a way to attain balance and resonate with holiness.

The practice of Kundalini, as it exists today, is a remnant of this a kind of Kemetic yoga. All yoga is descended from the original exercises taught to humans, but too much of the data has been lost for any being to actually attain full unity through the movements alone. Kundalini is the purest form that can still be learned, and therefore the most potent and dangerous as well. It can grant you an awakening to the energy within your own body; awareness and control of different systems that the conscious self thought to be cut off from.

I have heard that practitioners can begin to see spirits and... other subtle things more easily. I don't know much more than that but the teaching are usually coupled with dire warnings, which is probably why the pure movements died out to begin with. Why do the dangerous stuff when you can do more basic things that carry no risk?

I would say don't engage in Kundalini until you have a wise teacher who can protect you.

You will never be happy. You wrench out a fake "I know it's true!" every single morning and tell yourself others are going to believe. But deep inside you feel the depression creeping up like a weed, ready to crush you under the unbearable weight caused by the force you deny, Earth's gravity.

This is your fate. This is what you chose. There is no turning back.

I took a bit of influence from the Yeats poem, Leda and the Swan, "and being so caught up...did she put on his knowledge...before the indifferent beak let her drop? (cited from memory, so please forgive any errors)" The idea, that a sexuo-spiritual union with Athena (Wisdom) is by nature Aphrodisian and Cupidian - in need of the blessings of Demeter (metaphorically), and would by its very nature erase every mortal woe like the erosion of a sandbank by a great river, was the core of my inspiration. The purpose of the quote, was to demand distinction between the fruit of Wisdom, and Wisdom herself, I suppose. I am a Christian, btw. For me, all these names are mere symbolism. Any being which takes on their representation is playing to our fantasies and for their own purposes. I only say this so you can know where I stand, not to judge anyone, yet the metaphysical dynamos of Wisdom is no less potent for the symbol.

That would have meant you read nearly to the end anyway, wouldn't it? In any case, what Athena bears is a common symbol - Victory and The World, if I'm not mistaken. It is no Newtonian apple (Newton, also a Christian, by the by). When I say the "fruit" of Wisdom, I mean, presuming one has gained any wisdom, it necessarily bears fruits of the kind I've mentioned - Knowledge, Discernment, Insight, Prudence, etc. I don't know if you've ever read Plato's Meno dialogue (a discussion on Virtue), but after reading it, actually before even finishing it, I came to the same conclusion as Socrates. Virtue comes from God. Additionally, I came to another realization:

Both Vice and Virtue are multiplicative and their growth exponential. That is, Vice invites Vice, and Virtue, Virute - they proliferate their own kind. To quote Scripture again (because in so doing we can see the Wisdom of Almighty God), "each bearing seed according to its own kind." What appears to have been merely about biology we now see has spiritual application, so the first question becomes, "What makes an attribute (a virtue or a vice) invite another?" Thinking on it, I came to the conclusion the nature of them was to wax or wane into a related attribute. For instance, Temperance (a virtue), can invite Pride (a vice). The reason, that in ever-increasing success at retaining temperance, a person can begin to think themselves superior to those who do not. Just a simple example. Now the next question is, "What allows a person to maintain the balance - to prevent a person from birthing an vice of a virtue, or to enable a man to pursue a virtue he does not possess?" The obvious answer, is Wisdom.

God is the Father and giver of Virtue, and Wisdom could be called its nurse. She is the tender and keeper of all Virtues, and brings all necessities thereof - Knowledge and Understanding.

Peter broke many chains and formed none. He will outrank most in Heaven, and better not to speak of him as a slaver.

Nice. I came to the conclusion years ago that there is no randomness in the universe.
I believe this is what Einstein meant when he says "God doesn't play dice"

I explain it this way, if you're watching a game of pool and the player breaks (Make the first play) by shooting the que ball at the rack, if you're a novice, everything seems chaotic in that moment. You can think of all the matter and energy moving in the entire universe this way, it appears chaotic.
But in a game of pool, actually, everything is moving according to the laws of physics and a real pro at pool can make the balls go exactly where he wants them to, the game is not chaotic to him.
While we have such a limited view of the universe from our vantage point, it seems chaotic, but the forces that govern the movement of the balls on a pool table are a microcosm of the forces that govern the matter and energy throughout the universe.
This model of no true randomness fits both a religious and non religious view of the universe.
Were it not for consciousness the universe would just continue on a predetermined course, but since we have "free will" we can alter the course of matter and energy that was set when god gave the command to go.
If you're a complete materialist/atheist you can say our part in the universe is to just to go with the flow since we're just life that formed in a pool of ammonia and everything we are doing including posting on this forum is all an extrapolation from the big bang.

posts.com:
I walked into the bar, trying to shake off the chill that had settled over me as I'd walked through the rain-soaked streets. The place was nearly empty, save for a woman seated at the bar, nursing a drink.

I took a seat a few stools down from her, catching a glimpse of her face in the mirror behind the bar. She was beautiful, with long, dark hair and piercing green eyes that seemed to look right through me.

As I ordered my drink, I couldn't help but feel drawn to her. I found myself wanting to strike up a conversation, to get to know her. And as if she could sense my thoughts, she turned to me and smiled.

We talked for what felt like hours, the time slipping away as we laughed and shared stories. And before I knew it, it was closing time.

"Do you want to come back to my place?" I asked, the words tumbling out before I could think better of it.

She hesitated for a moment, and I was sure she was going to say no. But then she nodded, and we left the bar together, the rain having slowed to a drizzle.

We spent the night together, and it was amazing. I felt a connection to her that I couldn't quite explain. But when I woke up the next morning, she was gone.

I searched the apartment for any sign of her, but there was nothing. It was as if she had never been there.

But as I was getting ready to leave for work, I caught a glimpse of something in the mirror. And when I looked closer, I saw that I had a mark on my neck - a small bite mark, almost like a love bite.

I passed out later that day, my mind racing with questions. Who was this woman? And why did she have a tail and black wings? The thought of it sent shivers down my spine.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33803781
I woke up in a cold sweat, the image of the woman's wings burned into my mind. I couldn't shake the feeling that something wasn't right, that I had been taken in by some kind of supernatural being.

I spent the next few days in a state of constant anxiety, jumping at every shadow and unable to focus on anything. I knew I had to find out the truth, but I had no idea where to start.

Finally, I couldn't take it any longer. I grabbed my coat and headed out into the night, determined to find some answers.

I walked the streets for what felt like hours, my mind racing as I tried to piece together the events of that night. And just when I was about to give up, I saw her.

She was standing in an alleyway, her wings folded behind her as she leaned against the wall. She looked up as I approached, her green eyes piercing through the darkness.

"You shouldn't have followed me," she said, her voice laced with warning.

But I couldn't turn back now. I had to know the truth.

"Who are you?" I demanded. "What are you?"

She let out a sigh, as if she had been expecting this.

"I'm a succubus," she said, her voice barely above a whisper. "I feed on the life force of humans."

My heart raced as the pieces fell into place. I had been taken in by a creature of the night, and I had no idea how to escape her grasp.

But as I stood there, frozen with fear, she reached out and took my hand.

"It's okay," she said, her voice soothing. "I won't hurt you. I promise."

And in that moment, I believed her. I don't know if it was her power over me, or if it was something else, but I felt a sudden sense of calm wash over me.

I don't know what the future holds for me and the succubus. All I know is that I can't stay away from her, no matter how dangerous it might be.

Happenings Type:
Type A: Marks on your body,bruises,scratches
Type B: Knocking,cracking noises when going to sleep
Type C: Critters,Spiders,Worms etc. Found on your body
Type D: Puddle of Water in your Room
Type E: Moving objects, Objects falling over
Type F: Loud boom noices. Electrical discharges

Type. In order to give me the best occurence, i will now set it to types:
Type A: Dream happened during your normal sleep shedule
Type A1: Dream after your normal sleep shedule and going back to sleep and wake up again
Type B: Dream during a Nap
Type C: Nightmare only half or an hour into sleep (30-60 minutes)
Type D: Nightmare in the middle of the night (4+ hours)
Type E: Nightmare after normal sleep and you wake up in the morning with it. (6+ hours)
Type F: Double or Triple dream during the Night
Type G: Fever dream
Type Z: Dream lasts only 5-10 seconds. Very short.

Explanations:
Lucid= You are aware that it is a dream and you can act out yourself.
Vision= Super Clearly visible. It feels you are really there and its almost real.
Sleep Paralysis = Awake, but not able to move.

No real life names, use nicknames or Anon.

Please don´t use any memes and try to be nice.
Every person will be treated equally.

Be nice, stay classy and pray to Jesus and ask him for forgiveness. He is the only one and true way to everything you need to know about life.

If you think at this from a cosmological stance, Jupiter is essentially the reason that life on Earth was even possible. Jupiter is so massive and has a gravity well so enormous it pulls excessive meteorites, comets, and other celestial bodies that would have hit earth in towards itself instead. This is what happens to 99.99% of the world-ending bodies that float in space around us.

Saturn is also a Brown Dwarf but utterly lacked the mass to become a star as well. Jupiter is much larger than Saturn and was the first contender to be a binary star to Sol. Neither of them obtained the mass required for fusion to happen under pressure.

It's not hard. If you look for demons, you'll find them.

Every day, especially at night before bed, put your energy and intent into thoughts about a demon coming to meet you in a lucid dream. don't be specific about anything, don't use any names. Before you lay down to sleep, say to yourself aloud, "a demon will come to speak to me tonight".

That's it. The more you put your energy into doing that, the closer you'll get. You don't need anything else but you should have your questions prepared. You should also keep in mind that you're strangers meeting in a weird place. You might become something more, you might not. Be respectful and polite. Don't ask for things.

If you really want the, "magick" experience, you need to create
your own names and sigils. Make a sigil for it, you can think of it
like finding a spirit guide. Give that sigil (not the demon) a name.
Do not share the sigil or the name with anyone.

There's nothing to worry about with all of this, just be polite and
maintain composure. Do not in any way insult them when they come.
You should be sure you really want this though. This isn't like amazon grimoires or spooky short stories. This will work and if
that's something that might threaten your sanity or remove you
from some kind of weird fantasy, you shouldn't be fucking around
with any of it in my opinion.

I should mention, I did this and it took months. I didn't give up, I had questions that I needed answers to. I put that energy and that will into the desire to meet them and in my mind i was willing to accept that it might take years or decades. it took several months. nothing changed or progressed, it just happened. a lot was said and i was very honest about my own experience. from the beginning i said that i believed him to be a subconscious projection and he convinced me to just experience it. i asked for proof in a respectful way and he wasn't offended at all, he understood why. he told me some things that were very specific. names, really exact things that would happen. years later, it all happened exactly as he said. there's something in the mind though, it's almost like it never happened. it did, this is 100% the truth with no added frills, but it seems detached and unreal to me. at times i'll randomly sort of snap out of a daze and realize that those beings, whatever they really are, are very real and it's been proven to me. it's hard to accept, but i don't really know way. it feels like something hardwired into us.

if you go through with this, don't waste time like i did when it happens. just go with it, have your questions prepared, give them room to ask you questions. take a moment to look around, feel your hands, breathe the air, notice the colors, the textures, the smell of the air.

Atlantis is the Canaries and the Azores together. They're right where Atlantis should be, both island chains have a long history of volcanic activity, and there's been interesting ruins found at both of them. Atlantis was supposed to be a formidable power in the days before history. It stands to reason the island was of pretty significant size. So it's not one island chain or the other, but both of them; the Azores were in the north of the continent, the Canary Islands were in the south.

It's all located beyond the straits of Gibraltar, which is exactly where Plato said Atlantis was.

I don't know what the Richat structure is, it might be RELATED to Atlantis, but I don't think it's Atlantis itself.

It would be cool to think that something like a space whale might exist, either in our universe or the next. The planets? Giant balls of metal and gases. They either become suns, join suns, or orbit suns. Spores can live millions of years in the vacuum of space. We could be related by bacterial or fungal spore panspermia, amongst asteroid panspermia and other theories. Even if we came from vents on the bottom of the ocean, if life can only be created and evolve in one way, the Darwin model on earth, then we are basically de facto related. If they have DNA like ours and evolved from a primate-like niche, why couldn't they breed with us?

Simple extraterrestrial life such as algaes, planktons, amoebas, maybe even simple surface vegetation, is probably very common- maybe even abundant. I wouldn't be surprised if such organisms were found in subterranean Mars, underneath the ice of Europa, and in the atmosphere of Venus. Life seems to be extremely persistent, adaptable, and essentially impossible to permanently eliminate once conceived.
I'm expecting complex extraterrestrial life (things with bones) to be far less common, but not exactly rare. Animals might be a "once per solar system" kind of occurrence: only propagating on the most consistent climate-controlled kind of "goldilocks" planet in a given system. I don't agree with speculative biologists. At all. Alien animals will most likely be very similar to what we've already witnessed with Earth animals. It's like how Dinosaurs all evolved from a different common ancestor to Mammals, but despite this Dinosaurs and Mammals still developed into very similar creatures because they still ultimately needed to do and survive the same conditions and some designs are just "the meta".

Although OP kinda seems like he might be trolling with the space sea nonsense, he is not too far off

Life seems to be extremely persistent, adaptable, and essentially impossible to permanently eliminate once conceived.
I'm expecting complex extraterrestrial life (things with bones) to be far less common, but not exactly rare. Animals might be a "once per solar system" kind of occurrence: only propagating on the most consistent climate-controlled kind of "goldilocks" planet in a given system. I don't agree with speculative biologists. At all. Alien animals will most likely be very similar to what we've already witnessed with Earth animals. It's like how Dinosaurs all evolved from a different common ancestor to Mammals, but despite this Dinosaurs and Mammals still developed into very similar creatures because they still ultimately needed to do and survive the same conditions and some designs are just "the meta". It is basically the whole concept of niches here on earth. Every animal fits into their environment. The only differences between us and other intelligent aliens would be bone structure and facial structure. Most likely, we would both still be bipedal. And it wouldn't be incredibly impossible to breed with them especially if you can believe in fungal or bacterial spore panspermia. Or even this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NDhsYz-7tYQ&t=115s
And if there is only one singular way life can form in our universe, than we are basically related by default.

Both were on patrol at 1:45 am, when they heard a noise similar to radio interference which later became an acute whistle. The dog was released and rushed to the place where the noise was coming from, but returned sick, a process which was repeated a couple of times. Eventually, the dog started to circle them, (a technique meant to protect guard dogs' handlers). Trejo then allegedly spotted a human-shaped green light to his left. The being was about 3 meters tall. It seemed to be formed of small light points, and the brightness was more intense along its edges. The head was small and covered by something resembling a helmet. The arms were very long and had no apparent hands or feet. Trejo fainted; after which his colleagues opened fire at the creature. 40 to 50 bullets were fired, but the being simply disappeared. While Trejo was being assisted, the same sound as before was heard. The next morning, 50 men searched the whole area but found no bullet casings or bullet holes. DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.
